title: Israel Targeted Hamas Leadership in Qatar Strike
summary: The Gulf nation of Qatar has been trying to negotiate a cease-fire in the conflict. The attack threatened to destabilize those peace efforts.

title: Hamas Fighters Claim Responsibility for Bus Stop Shooting in Jerusalem
summary: Israeli officials said the attack at the crowded bus stop on Monday spurred, in part, the decision to launch Tuesday’s targeted strikes against Hamas leaders in Qatar.

title: Elizabeth Tsurkov, Princeton Student, Is Released From Iraq, Trump Says
summary: Israel and Iraq confirmed the release of Elizabeth Tsurkov, a Russian-Israeli graduate student at Princeton who was kidnapped in Iraq in 2023 by the militant group Kataib Hezbollah.

title: Supreme Court Lets Trump Block Foreign Aid for Now
summary: Acting on his own, the chief justice issued an “administrative stay” pausing a trial judge’s ruling while the full court considers the matter.

title: Gabbard Retracted Intelligence Report on Venezuela
summary: The report, which remains classified, described work by Richard Grenell, a former top intelligence official in the Trump administration.

title: A Phony Trump Check and a ‘Depreciated’ Woman in Epstein’s Birthday Book
summary: A photo in Jeffrey Epstein’s birthday book shows the disgraced financier holding a novelty check with a signature of “DJ TRUMP.” It includes a woman who dated both men in the 1990s.

title: Latest Revelations Complicate Trump’s Sweeping Denials About Epstein
summary: President Trump often succeeds in pivoting the national conversation, but he is finding that more difficult when it comes to Jeffrey Epstein.

title: Republicans Shrug at Epstein Birthday Sketch Apparently Signed by Trump
summary: The Republican response to the release of a suggestive note to Jeffrey Epstein apparently signed by President Trump followed a familiar pattern of deflection.

title: Effort to Force a House Vote on Epstein Files Nears Success
summary: Supporters are on the brink of collecting the 218 signatures to proceed, but House Republican leaders and the White House are trying to stop it.

title: RFK Jr. Releases Childhood Health Report
summary: The report, which follows a draft leaked last month, demonstrates both the ambitions and limits of Robert F. Kennedy Jr.’s “Make America Healthy Again” agenda.

title: Takeaways From RFK Jr.’s Childhood Health Report
summary: A report from the commission led by Health Secretary Robert F. Kennedy Jr. is soft on pesticides, pledges to define ultraprocessed foods and promised an “infertility training center.”

title: Troops Deployed After Day of Violent Protests in Nepal
summary: Protesters set fire to government buildings and the homes of politicians as unrest over corruption, censorship and economic issues stretched into a second day.

title: For Nepal’s Protesters, Wealthy ‘Nepo Kids’ Are a Source of Outrage
summary: Videos and photos purporting to show the privileged lifestyles of children of the elite have fueled anger among young people.

title: Fears Return for L.A. Immigrants After Supreme Court Allows Raids to Resume
summary: Los Angeles residents are anxious once again following a Supreme Court ruling that allowed aggressive immigration raids to resume.

title: Nick Fuentes: A White Nationalist Problem for the Right
summary: For years, conservatives hoped that the notorious white nationalist would go away. Instead, Mr. Fuentes has gained more traction, even while opposing the president.

title: Damar Hamlin Nearly Died on the Football Field. He Had a Plan B.
summary: Damar Hamlin’s heart stopped beating after a tackle on “Monday Night Football” in 2023. He wants to be known for more than that.

title: Apple Introduces iPhone 17, iPhone Air and Updated AirPods at Annual Event
summary: The Silicon Valley giant also introduced updates to its traditional smartphones, as well as its AirPods and Apple Watch.

title: James Walkinshaw, Democrat of Virginia, Wins House Special Election
summary: James Walkinshaw will fill a seat left open by the death of his former boss, Gerald Connolly, and shrink the Republicans’ majority in the chamber.

title: Boston Mayor Faces Off Against Three Challengers in Preliminary Election
summary: The two top vote-getters on Tuesday will compete in November. They are expected to be Mayor Michelle Wu and Josh Kraft, a political newcomer and a son of the New England Patriots owner.

title: The Starbucks Turnaround That Has Baristas and Customers Steamed
summary: Improved service, better seating and heartfelt messages are at the heart of Brian Niccol’s turnaround plan, but baristas say they’re under pressure.

title: Oliver North and Fawn Hall, Key Figures in Iran-Contra Scandal, Are Married
summary: Ms. Hall was Mr. North’s secretary on the National Security Council in the 1980s during the secret sales of arms to Iran and the diversion of the profits to rebel forces in Nicaragua.

title: Suspect in Couple’s Fiery Deaths Went Door to Door Asking to Come In
summary: Rescuers who came to a burning house in Queens found Frank Olton, 76, bound in the basement and his wife, Maureen, 77, dead on the first floor. The police were seeking a man with a lengthy criminal record.

title: Can Trump Deflate the Epstein Birthday-Book Scandal?
summary: Even compelling debunkings don’t eliminate the mystery.

title: Gesture Politics Won’t Help Palestinians
summary: But diaspora Jews will pay an ugly price.

title: Israel Launched an Attack in Qatar, Targeting Hamas Leaders
summary: Also, a look at what’s in R.F.K. Jr.’s report on childhood health. Here’s the latest at the end of Tuesday.

title: Curtis Sliwa Vows to Stay in Mayor’s Race, Despite Push to Clear Field
summary: Business leaders who hope Mr. Sliwa, the Republican nominee for New York City mayor, will suspend his campaign may find themselves disappointed: “No, no, no. A thousand times no,” he said.

title: Man Accused in Brutal N.C. Rail Slaying Faces Federal Charge
summary: A conviction would make the man, who is accused of killing a Ukrainian refugee on a light rail train in Charlotte, eligible for the federal death penalty.

title: California Man Killed 2 Men He Met on Dating App, Authorities Say
summary: Prosecutors said Rockim Prowell, 34, also stole their cars and tried to kill a third man. He was being held without bail.

title: James Talarico Joins Senate Campaign in Texas
summary: State Representative James Talarico, who is studying to become a Presbyterian pastor, has sparred with Fox News hosts and bantered with Joe Rogan. Now he wants Senator John Cornyn’s seat.
